00074   /* These are the 'types' of BIOs */
00075 #define BIO_TYPE_NONE       0
00076 #define BIO_TYPE_MEM        (1|0x0400)
00077 #define BIO_TYPE_FILE       (2|0x0400)
00078 
00079 #define BIO_TYPE_FD     (4|0x0400|0x0100)
00080 #define BIO_TYPE_SOCKET     (5|0x0400|0x0100)
00081 #define BIO_TYPE_NULL       (6|0x0400)
00082 #define BIO_TYPE_SSL        (7|0x0200)
00083 #define BIO_TYPE_MD     (8|0x0200)      /* passive filter */
00084 #define BIO_TYPE_BUFFER     (9|0x0200)      /* filter */
00085 #define BIO_TYPE_CIPHER     (10|0x0200)     /* filter */
00086 #define BIO_TYPE_BASE64     (11|0x0200)     /* filter */
00087 #define BIO_TYPE_CONNECT    (12|0x0400|0x0100)      /* socket - connect */
00088 #define BIO_TYPE_ACCEPT     (13|0x0400|0x0100)      /* socket for accept */
00089 #define BIO_TYPE_PROXY_CLIENT   (14|0x0200)     /* client proxy BIO */
00090 #define BIO_TYPE_PROXY_SERVER   (15|0x0200)     /* server proxy BIO */
00091 #define BIO_TYPE_NBIO_TEST  (16|0x0200)     /* server proxy BIO */
00092 #define BIO_TYPE_NULL_FILTER    (17|0x0200)
00093 #define BIO_TYPE_BER        (18|0x0200)     /* BER -> bin filter */
00094 #define BIO_TYPE_BIO        (19|0x0400)     /* (half a) BIO pair */
00095 #define BIO_TYPE_LINEBUFFER (20|0x0200)     /* filter */
00096 
00097 #define BIO_TYPE_DESCRIPTOR 0x0100  /* socket, fd, connect or accept */
00098 #define BIO_TYPE_FILTER     0x0200
00099 #define BIO_TYPE_SOURCE_SINK    0x0400
00100 
00101   /* BIO_FILENAME_READ|BIO_CLOSE to open or close on free.
00102    * BIO_set_fp(in,stdin,BIO_NOCLOSE); */
00103 #define BIO_NOCLOSE     0x00
00104 #define BIO_CLOSE       0x01
00105 
00106   /* These are used in the following macros and are passed to
00107    * BIO_ctrl() */
00108 #define BIO_CTRL_RESET      1       /* opt - rewind/zero etc */
00109 #define BIO_CTRL_EOF        2       /* opt - are we at the eof */
00110 #define BIO_CTRL_INFO       3       /* opt - extra tit-bits */
00111 #define BIO_CTRL_SET        4       /* man - set the 'IO' type */
00112 #define BIO_CTRL_GET        5       /* man - get the 'IO' type */
00113 #define BIO_CTRL_PUSH       6       /* opt - internal, used to signify change */
00114 #define BIO_CTRL_POP        7       /* opt - internal, used to signify change */
00115 #define BIO_CTRL_GET_CLOSE  8       /* man - set the 'close' on free */
00116 #define BIO_CTRL_SET_CLOSE  9       /* man - set the 'close' on free */
00117 #define BIO_CTRL_PENDING    10      /* opt - is their more data buffered */
00118 #define BIO_CTRL_FLUSH      11      /* opt - 'flush' buffered output */
00119 #define BIO_CTRL_DUP        12      /* man - extra stuff for 'duped' BIO */
00120 #define BIO_CTRL_WPENDING   13      /* opt - number of bytes still to write */
00121   /* callback is int cb(BIO *bio,state,ret); */
00122 #define BIO_CTRL_SET_CALLBACK   14      /* opt - set callback function */
00123 #define BIO_CTRL_GET_CALLBACK   15      /* opt - set callback function */
00124 
00125 #define BIO_CTRL_SET_FILENAME   30      /* BIO_s_file special */
00126 
00127   /* modifiers */
00128 #define BIO_FP_READ     0x02
00129 #define BIO_FP_WRITE        0x04
00130 #define BIO_FP_APPEND       0x08
00131 #define BIO_FP_TEXT     0x10
00132 
00133 #define BIO_FLAGS_READ      0x01
00134 #define BIO_FLAGS_WRITE     0x02
00135 #define BIO_FLAGS_IO_SPECIAL    0x04
00136 #define BIO_FLAGS_RWS (BIO_FLAGS_READ|BIO_FLAGS_WRITE|BIO_FLAGS_IO_SPECIAL)
00137 #define BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY  0x08
00138 
00139   /* Used in BIO_gethostbyname() */
00140 #define BIO_GHBN_CTRL_HITS      1
00141 #define BIO_GHBN_CTRL_MISSES        2
00142 #define BIO_GHBN_CTRL_CACHE_SIZE    3
00143 #define BIO_GHBN_CTRL_GET_ENTRY     4
00144 #define BIO_GHBN_CTRL_FLUSH     5
00145 
00146   /* Mostly used in the SSL BIO */
00147   /* Not used anymore
00148    * #define BIO_FLAGS_PROTOCOL_DELAYED_READ 0x10
00149    * #define BIO_FLAGS_PROTOCOL_DELAYED_WRITE 0x20
00150    * #define BIO_FLAGS_PROTOCOL_STARTUP   0x40
00151    */
00152 
00153 #define BIO_FLAGS_BASE64_NO_NL  0x100
00154 
00155   /* This is used with memory BIOs: it means we shouldn't free up or change the
00156    * data in any way.
00157    */
00158 #define BIO_FLAGS_MEM_RDONLY    0x200
00159 
00160 #define BIO_set_flags(b,f) ((b)->flags|=(f))
00161 #define BIO_get_flags(b) ((b)->flags)
00162 #define BIO_set_retry_special(b) \
00163         ((b)->flags|=(BIO_FLAGS_IO_SPECIAL|BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY))
00164 #define BIO_set_retry_read(b) \
00165         ((b)->flags|=(BIO_FLAGS_READ|BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY))
00166 #define BIO_set_retry_write(b) \
00167         ((b)->flags|=(BIO_FLAGS_WRITE|BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY))
00168 
00169   /* These are normally used internally in BIOs */
00170 #define BIO_clear_flags(b,f) ((b)->flags&= ~(f))
00171 #define BIO_clear_retry_flags(b) \
00172         ((b)->flags&= ~(BIO_FLAGS_RWS|BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY))
00173 #define BIO_get_retry_flags(b) \
00174         ((b)->flags&(BIO_FLAGS_RWS|BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY))
00175 
00176   /* These should be used by the application to tell why we should retry */
00177 #define BIO_should_read(a)      ((a)->flags & BIO_FLAGS_READ)
00178 #define BIO_should_write(a)     ((a)->flags & BIO_FLAGS_WRITE)
00179 #define BIO_should_io_special(a)    ((a)->flags & BIO_FLAGS_IO_SPECIAL)
00180 #define BIO_retry_type(a)       ((a)->flags & BIO_FLAGS_RWS)
00181 #define BIO_should_retry(a)     ((a)->flags & BIO_FLAGS_SHOULD_RETRY)
00182 
00183   /* The next three are used in conjunction with the
00184    * BIO_should_io_special() condition.  After this returns true,
00185    * BIO *BIO_get_retry_BIO(BIO *bio, int *reason); will walk the BIO 
00186    * stack and return the 'reason' for the special and the offending BIO.
00187    * Given a BIO, BIO_get_retry_reason(bio) will return the code. */
00188   /* Returned from the SSL bio when the certificate retrieval code had an error */
00189 #define BIO_RR_SSL_X509_LOOKUP      0x01
00190   /* Returned from the connect BIO when a connect would have blocked */
00191 #define BIO_RR_CONNECT          0x02
00192   /* Returned from the accept BIO when an accept would have blocked */
00193 #define BIO_RR_ACCEPT           0x03
00194 
00195   /* These are passed by the BIO callback */
00196 #define BIO_CB_FREE 0x01
00197 #define BIO_CB_READ 0x02
00198 #define BIO_CB_WRITE    0x03
00199 #define BIO_CB_PUTS 0x04
00200 #define BIO_CB_GETS 0x05
00201 #define BIO_CB_CTRL 0x06
00202 
00203   /* The callback is called before and after the underling operation,
00204    * The BIO_CB_RETURN flag indicates if it is after the call */
00205 #define BIO_CB_RETURN   0x80
00206 #define BIO_CB_return(a) ((a)|BIO_CB_RETURN))
00207 #define BIO_cb_pre(a)   (!((a)&BIO_CB_RETURN))
00208 #define BIO_cb_post(a)  ((a)&BIO_CB_RETURN)
00209 
00210 #define BIO_set_callback(b,cb)      ((b)->callback=(cb))
00211 #define BIO_set_callback_arg(b,arg) ((b)->cb_arg=(char *)(arg))
00212 #define BIO_get_callback_arg(b)     ((b)->cb_arg)
00213 #define BIO_get_callback(b)     ((b)->callback)
00214 #define BIO_method_name(b)      ((b)->method->name)
00215 #define BIO_method_type(b)      ((b)->method->type)
00216 
00217   typedef struct bio_st BIO;
00218 
00219   typedef void bio_info_cb (struct bio_st *, int, const char *, int, long,
00220     long);
00221 
00222 #ifndef OPENSSL_SYS_WIN16
00223   typedef struct bio_method_st {
00224     int type;
00225     const char *name;
00226     int (*bwrite) (BIO *, const char *, int);
00227     int (*bread) (BIO *, char *, int);
00228     int (*bputs) (BIO *, const char *);
00229     int (*bgets) (BIO *, char *, int);
00230     long (*ctrl) (BIO *, int, long, void *);
00231     int (*create) (BIO *);
00232     int (*destroy) (BIO *);
00233     long (*callback_ctrl) (BIO *, int, bio_info_cb *);
00234   } BIO_METHOD;
00235 #else
00236   typedef struct bio_method_st {
00237     int type;
00238     const char *name;
00239     int (_far * bwrite) ();
00240     int (_far * bread) ();
00241     int (_far * bputs) ();
00242     int (_far * bgets) ();
00243     long (_far * ctrl) ();
00244     int (_far * create) ();
00245     int (_far * destroy) ();
00246     long (_far * callback_ctrl) ();
00247   } BIO_METHOD;
00248 #endif
00249 
00250   struct bio_st {
00251     BIO_METHOD *method;
00252     /* bio, mode, argp, argi, argl, ret */
00253     long (*callback) (struct bio_st *, int, const char *, int, long, long);
00254     char *cb_arg;               /* first argument for the callback */
00255 
00256     int init;
00257     int shutdown;
00258     int flags;                  /* extra storage */
00259     int retry_reason;
00260     int num;
00261     void *ptr;
00262     struct bio_st *next_bio;    /* used by filter BIOs */
00263     struct bio_st *prev_bio;    /* used by filter BIOs */
00264     int references;
00265     unsigned long num_read;
00266     unsigned long num_write;
00267 
00268     CRYPTO_EX_DATA ex_data;
00269   };
00270 
00271     DECLARE_STACK_OF (BIO)
00272 
00273     typedef struct bio_f_buffer_ctx_struct {
00274     /* BIO *bio; *//* this is now in the BIO struct */
00275     int ibuf_size;              /* how big is the input buffer */
00276     int obuf_size;              /* how big is the output buffer */
00277 
00278     char *ibuf;                 /* the char array */
00279     int ibuf_len;               /* how many bytes are in it */
00280     int ibuf_off;               /* write/read offset */
00281 
00282     char *obuf;                 /* the char array */
00283     int obuf_len;               /* how many bytes are in it */
00284     int obuf_off;               /* write/read offset */
00285   } BIO_F_BUFFER_CTX;
00286

00290 #define BIO_CONN_S_GET_PORT     3

00293 #define BIO_CONN_S_OK           6

00352   /* BIO_s_connect() and BIO_s_socks4a_connect() */
00353 #define BIO_set_conn_hostname(b,name) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_CONNECT,0,(char *)name)
00354 #define BIO_set_conn_port(b,port) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_CONNECT,1,(char *)port)
00355 #define BIO_set_conn_ip(b,ip)     BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_CONNECT,2,(char *)ip)
00356 #define BIO_set_conn_int_port(b,port) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_CONNECT,3,(char *)port)
00357 #define BIO_get_conn_hostname(b)  BIO_ptr_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_CONNECT,0)
00358 #define BIO_get_conn_port(b)      BIO_ptr_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_CONNECT,1)
00359 #define BIO_get_conn_ip(b)       BIO_ptr_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_CONNECT,2)
00360 #define BIO_get_conn_int_port(b) BIO_int_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_CONNECT,3)

00369 #define BIO_set_nbio_accept(b,n) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_ACCEPT,1,(n)?"a":NULL)
00370 #define BIO_set_accept_bios(b,bio) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_ACCEPT,2,(char *)bio)

00406   /* name is cast to lose const, but might be better to route through a function
00407      so we can do it safely */
00408 #ifdef CONST_STRICT
00409   /* If you are wondering why this isn't defined, its because CONST_STRICT is
00410    * purely a compile-time kludge to allow const to be checked.
00411    */
00412   int BIO_read_filename (BIO * b, const char *name);
00413 #else
00414 #define BIO_read_filename(b,name) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_FILENAME, \
00415         BIO_CLOSE|BIO_FP_READ,(char *)name)
00416 #endif
00417 #define BIO_write_filename(b,name) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_FILENAME, \
00418         BIO_CLOSE|BIO_FP_WRITE,name)
00419 #define BIO_append_filename(b,name) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_FILENAME, \
00420         BIO_CLOSE|BIO_FP_APPEND,name)
00421 #define BIO_rw_filename(b,name) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_FILENAME, \
00422         BIO_CLOSE|BIO_FP_READ|BIO_FP_WRITE,name)
00423 
00424   /* WARNING WARNING, this ups the reference count on the read bio of the
00425    * SSL structure.  This is because the ssl read BIO is now pointed to by
00426    * the next_bio field in the bio.  So when you free the BIO, make sure
00427    * you are doing a BIO_free_all() to catch the underlying BIO. */
00428 #define BIO_set_ssl(b,ssl,c)    BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_SET_SSL,c,(char *)ssl)
00429 #define BIO_get_ssl(b,sslp) BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_SSL,0,(char *)sslp)
